title: The ‘Problem’ This Doctor Put On a Patient’s Record Exposes a Ridiculous Stigma
text:
Continue Reading After This Advertisement After more phone calls and discussion, Rodriguez updated her post: 
But she still doesn’t want that on her chart at all — whether they’re “protecting” her or not. 
“We can’t go around with medical charts putting: widow, divorced, Jewish, lesbian just so that employees don’t screw up and accidentally offend someone,” Rodriguez said. 
“I’m pretty confident about who I am,” she continued. “But not everybody is. For [lesbianism] to be on a chart for someone who is maybe an adolescent, and their parents find out that way, or their school, or their job… it could have been a really big deal. People are ending their lives over this every day.” And despite people urging her to sue, that's not in the plans for her. via: Facebook 
She just wants to bring change and let people know that being a lesbian is not a problem. 
On the other hand, she’s also wondering if maybe her “medical condition” can get her a few extra days off. 
“Maybe I can call out of work for my condition,” she joked. “I’m not sure.” 
Jokes aside, it’s 2017 and this is still an issue. That’s a problem — unlike someone’s sexual orientation.
